commits.message:
Fix: infisto storage, create results file on scan init

In case the storage for a new scan was initialized, the file for the results was missing
Now creating a file for the results with an empty Vec

forkee.name: openvas-scanner
forkee.description: This repository contains the scanner component for Greenbone Community Edition.

commits.message: Remove: greenbonebot token from update-header.yml
Fix clippy error
Add: permission pull-requests write into update-header.yml (#1510)

Fix: fix an issue which produces an interrupted scan, originated on a wrong count of excluded hosts. (#1509)

Since excluded hosts are handled in OSPD, we need to keep the total host count which includes the hosts which will be excluded later
Automated commit: change version from 22.7.5 -> 22.7.6

Change: add a dummy item in the redis storage for backward compatibility (#1514)

* Change: add a dummy item in the redis storage for backward compatibility

Since openvas uses positional items and expects the plugin oid in the second position, add a dummy item under filename key

* fix test

Add: Verify signature of sha256sums file (#1505)

* Add: Verify signature of sha256sums file

* Update README files

* Use own fork of libssh-rs, which unpins the openssl-sys version from libssh-rs

* Fix typos

* fix tests

* Since I got an answer from the libssh-rs developer, now the dependency issue is solved and we can use the crate again

* Add: add 'signature-check' command line option to nasl-cli

This allows to enable the feed signature check.

* Add: add possibility to enable signature check to openvasd

This allows to enable the feed signature check before getting the OIDs. This can be performed via the signature-check cmd-line opiton
or via the config file.

* update readme
Add: health endpoints to openAPI (#1515)

Add: full installation guide

The installation guide contains step by step instructions to install everything necessary to start a scan with openvasd. It also includes a instructions for configure systemd to setup ospd-openvas, notus-scanner and openvasd as services.

Add: dep-graph library for scheduler

This library originates from https://github.com/nmoutschen/dep-graph
It is used to create a dependency graph for plugins and iterate over its notes either sequentiel or in parallel

Add: Prototype for Plugin Scheduler

This prototoype contains a plugin scheduler, which automatically resolves dependencies and enables execution of plugins either sequential or parallel

Add: dep-graph library for scheduler

This library originates from https://github.com/nmoutschen/dep-graph
It is used to create a dependency graph for plugins and iterate over its notes either sequentiel or in parallel

Add: Prototype for Plugin Scheduler

This prototoype contains a plugin scheduler, which automatically resolves dependencies and enables execution of plugins either sequential or parallel
Add: health endpoints to openAPI (#1515)

Add: full installation guide

The installation guide contains step by step instructions to install everything necessary to start a scan with openvasd. It also includes a instructions for configure systemd to setup ospd-openvas, notus-scanner and openvasd as services.

Change: ingress example within openvasd

Changes ingress example within values of openvasd to be traefik for a
single http instance.

Change: add mtls definition

Unfortunately mtls does only work when there is
either an ingress configured for passthrough or
when there is no ingress defined.

Currently there is only an example without ingress
that is used within in our tests.

Change: add mtls definition

Unfortunately mtls does only work when there is
either an ingress configured for passthrough or
when there is no ingress defined.

Currently there is only an example without ingress
that is used within in our tests.
Change: add https definition

Add: full installation guide

The installation guide contains step by step instructions to install everything necessary to start a scan with openvasd. It also includes a instructions for configure systemd to setup ospd-openvas, notus-scanner and openvasd as services.

pull_request.title: Add: health endpoints to openAPI
pull_request.body:
**What**:
Add: health endpoints to openAPI
Jira: SC-938
<!--
  Describe what changes are being made, e.g. which feature/bug is being
  developed/fixed in this PR?
-->

**Why**:
Kubernetes probes
<!-- Why are these changes necessary? -->

**How**:
`curl --verbose  --insecure --request GET https://127.0.0.1:3000/health/ready -H "X-API-KEY: some-secret" | jq .`
